summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs news briefing from May 7, 2021, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes a brief mention of a document detailing meetings between Eric Lander and Jeffrey Epstein, but the document itself is not provided. The briefing primarily focuses on Capitol riot arrests, COVID-19, infrastructure, voting laws, and other current events.

persons.name: Eric Lander
persons.role: Office of Science and Technology Policy Director-designate
persons.context: Mentioned in a Politico report about his past meetings with Jeffrey Epstein in 2012, which were under scrutiny during his nomination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having had meetings with Eric Lander in 2012. Described as 'late convicted sex offender'.

connections.description: Reportedly had meetings spanning approximately 90 minutes over two events in the spring of 2012, as detailed in a document obtained by Politico.

events.title: Lander-Epstein Meetings
events.description: Eric Lander met with Jeffrey Epstein for approximately 90 minutes over two events in the spring of 2012.

keyFacts: A Politico report details that Eric Lander's meetings with Jeffrey Epstein spanned about 90 minutes over two events in spring 2012.
The document's details largely align with Lander and the White House's descriptions of the meetings as brief interactions.
The news briefing is a broad summary of current events; the Epstein-Lander reference is a single, minor item among many unrelated stories.
The document referenced (detailing the meetings) is not included in the provided text; only a summary of its findings is reported.
Jeffrey Epstein is referred to as the 'late convicted sex offender'.
